016package edu.cnm.deepdive.appstarter.service;
017
018import android.app.Activity;
019import android.content.Context;
020import android.content.pm.PackageInfo;
021import android.content.pm.PackageManager;
022import android.content.pm.PackageManager.NameNotFoundException;
023import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
024import androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat;
025import androidx.core.content.ContextCompat;
026import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
027import androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;
028import androidx.navigation.NavController;
029import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
030import edu.cnm.deepdive.appstarter.NavigationGraphDirections;
031import java.util.HashSet;
032import java.util.LinkedList;
033import java.util.List;
034import java.util.Objects;
035import java.util.Set;
036import javax.inject.Inject;
037import javax.inject.Singleton;
038
039/**
040 * Implements a {@link LiveData}-based repository of permissions granted by the user, and handles
041 * the low-level details of the permissions flow. Note that while this class is declared (using
042 * {@link Singleton}) as a singleton, the {@link #startPermissionsCheck(Activity, NavController)},
043 * {@link #requestPermissions(Activity, String[])}, and
044 * {@link #handlePermissionsRequestResult(int, String[], int[])} methods are <em>not</em>
045 * thread-safe; as a rule, those should be invoked only by an instance of
046 * {@link edu.cnm.deepdive.appstarter.viewmodel.PermissionsViewModel}, which should in turn be
047 * scoped to the main activity of the app.
048 */
049@Singleton
050public class PermissionsRepository {
051
052  private static final int PERMISSIONS_REQUEST_CODE = 128158634;
053
054  private final MutableLiveData<Set<String>> permissions;
055
056  @Inject
057  PermissionsRepository(@SuppressWarnings("unused") @ApplicationContext Context context) {
058    permissions = new MutableLiveData<>(new HashSet<>());
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Returns {@link LiveData} of all permissions declared in {@code AndroidManifest.xml} that have
063   * been granted (implicitly or explicitly) to the app.
064   */
065  public LiveData<Set<String>> getPermissions() {
066    return permissions;
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Sets the permission flow in motion. This proceeds by obtaining a {@link String String[]} of all
071   * permissions declared in <code>AndroidManifest.xml</code>, invoking
072   * {@link ContextCompat#checkSelfPermission(Context, String)} to determine what permissions must
073   * be requested from the user, invoking
074   * {@link ActivityCompat#shouldShowRequestPermissionRationale(Activity, String)} to learn which of
075   * those permissions should be explained to the user before requesting, and taking the appropriate
076   * next step.
077   *
078   * @param activity      {@link Activity} initiating the flow and providing the
079   *                      {@link Activity#onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[])}
080   *                      callback.
081   * @param navController {@link NavController} used if/when navigating to the {@link
082   *                      edu.cnm.deepdive.appstarter.controller.PermissionsExplanationFragment}.
083   */
084  public void startPermissionsCheck(Activity activity, NavController navController) {
085    try {
086      String[] permissionsNeeded = getManifestPermissions(activity);
087      Set<String> permissionsGranted = permissions.getValue();
088      List<String> permissionsToRequest = new LinkedList<>();
089      List<String> permissionsToExplain = new LinkedList<>();
090      queryPermissionGrants(activity,
091          permissionsNeeded, permissionsGranted, permissionsToRequest, permissionsToExplain);
092      permissions.postValue(permissionsGranted);
093      if (!permissionsToExplain.isEmpty()) {
094        navController.navigate(NavigationGraphDirections.explainPermissions(
095            permissionsToExplain.toArray(new String[0]),
096            permissionsToRequest.toArray(new String[0])));
097      } else if (!permissionsToRequest.isEmpty()) {
098        requestPermissions(activity, permissionsToRequest.toArray(new String[0]));
099      }
100    } catch (NameNotFoundException e) {
101      throw new RuntimeException(e);
102    }
103  }
104
105  /**
106   * Continues the permissions flow after rationales (if any) have been displayed to the user.
107   *
108   * @param activity    {@link Activity} providing the
109   *                    {@link Activity#onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[])} callback.
110   * @param permissions Permissions to be requested of the user.
111   */
112  public void requestPermissions(Activity activity, String[] permissions) {
113    ActivityCompat.requestPermissions(activity, permissions, PERMISSIONS_REQUEST_CODE);
114  }
115
116  /**
117   * Handles response passed (indirectly) from
118   * {@link Activity#onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[])}, adding all granted
119   * permissions to a {@link LiveData LiveData&lt;Set&lt;String&gt;&gt;}.
120   *
121   * @param requestCode          Request code received by
122   *                             {@link Activity#onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[])},
123   *                             which must match a private constant in this class.
124   * @param permissionsRequested {@link String String[]} containing all permissions requested of the
125   *                             user by last invocation of
126   *                             {@link #requestPermissions(Activity, String[])}
127   * @param grantResults         {@code int[]} of grant/deny results.
128   * @return {@code true} if {@code requestCode} matched the expected value and results were
129   * processed; {@code false} otherwise.
130   */
131  public boolean handlePermissionsRequestResult(int requestCode,
132      @NonNull String[] permissionsRequested,
133      @NonNull int[] grantResults) {
134    boolean handled;
135    if (requestCode == PERMISSIONS_REQUEST_CODE) {
136      Set<String> permissions = Objects.requireNonNull(this.permissions.getValue());
137      for (int i = 0; i < permissionsRequested.length; i++) {
138        String permission = permissionsRequested[i];
139        int result = grantResults[i];
140        if (result == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) {
141          permissions.add(permission);
142        } else {
143          permissions.remove(permission);
144        }
145      }
146      this.permissions.postValue(permissions);
147      handled = true;
148    } else {
149      handled = false;
150    }
151    return handled;
152  }
153
154  private String[] getManifestPermissions(Activity activity) throws NameNotFoundException {
155    //noinspection deprecation
156    PackageInfo info = activity
157        .getPackageManager()
158        .getPackageInfo(activity.getPackageName(),
159            PackageManager.GET_META_DATA | PackageManager.GET_PERMISSIONS);
160    return info.requestedPermissions;
161  }
162
163  private void queryPermissionGrants(Activity activity,
164      String[] permissionsNeeded, Set<String> permissionsGranted,
165      List<String> permissionsToRequest, List<String> permissionsToExplain) {
166    for (String permission : permissionsNeeded) {
167      if (ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(activity, permission)
168          != PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) {
169        permissionsToRequest.add(permission);
170        if (ActivityCompat.shouldShowRequestPermissionRationale(activity, permission)) {
171          permissionsToExplain.add(permission);
172        }
173      } else {
174        permissionsGranted.add(permission);
175      }
176    }
177  }
178
179}
